headline: Donald Trump Mocks Joe Biden at Arizona Rally, Mimics the President's Voice: 'I'm Gonna Get Rid of COVID'
author: Mary Webber
sentences:
Joe Biden Avoided Naming Donald Trump in Speech Marking Capitol Riot Anniversary, Here's Why
Donald Trump's Arizona Rally
A former Arizona news anchor and gubernatorial candidate, Kari Lake, gave one of the opening speeches at Donald Trump's rally.

During a "Save America" rally in Florence, Trump said that people knew that Biden "would be not so good, but few could have imagined that he would be such a disaster for this country," Business Insider reported.
Aside from Joe Biden, Donald Trump has also targeted New York state Attorney General Letitia James, who has shown a desire to go after Trump for longstanding accusations of fraud.
Former President Donald Trump blasted President Joe Biden's handling of the COVID-19 pandemic and even tried to mimic the president's voice at his Arizona rally on Saturday.

READ MORE: Justice Department Indicts Steve Bannon with Contempt of Congress for Refusing to Comply Capitol Riot Subpoena
This article is owned by Latin Post.
It seemed that Trump was referring to COVID cases heading into the Labor Day weekend last September, which were four times higher than the same time in 2020.
Newsweek reported that a clip of Trump's speech, which included the mimic, has been viewed more than 50,000 times since it was shared on Twitter by Newsmax.
The former president also showed sympathy for Ashli Babbitt, a rioter shot and killed by a Capitol police officer after she stormed the building.
He repeated claims of impropriety and said that Democrats used measures during the pandemic to use the mail-in voting to steal the election.
According to Cyber Ninjas, a company Republicans hired to examine the voting in Arizona, Donald Trump lost the state by about 10,500 votes.
Trump also expressed sympathy for some rioters who are currently imprisoned awaiting trial for their actions at the U.S. Capitol.
Trump added that the bathrooms are horrible and called on people to hold the imprisoned rioters if they think they are innocent.

Donald Trump Mimics Joe Biden At Arizona Rally
Donald Trump then noted that there are four times more COVID cases now.
He touted the conspiracy theory that Ray Epps was a government informant and pushed people to come into the Capitol.

Written by: Mary Webber
WATCH: Trump Holds Rally in Florence for GOP Candidates in Arizona - From FOX 10 Phoenix
The former president went on, mimicking Biden's voice, and said: "Remember, I'm gonna get rid of COVID."
He talked about how he won the election and continued to claim that he won the 2020 presidential race.
Trump opened the rally by saying, "The Big Lie is a lot of bulls***," the Independent reported.
Trump also dismissed concerns about the January 6 Capitol attack by a mob of his supporters.
James is currently involved in a case pursuing the Trump Organization for fraud claims.
Epps was previously on the Federal Bureau of Investigation's most-wanted list.
The former president also promoted conspiracy theories regarding the election.
"Why aren't they investigating November 3rd a Rigged and Stolen Election...
Trump also moved his fist in a way that seemed to mimic Biden's gestures.
Trump's attempt to mock the president had won approval from the crowd.
"I ran twice and we won twice and we did better the second time.
They got duped and they found out what happened," Trump noted.
Many rallygoers could be heard briefly laughing in response.
He said that those people are currently "living in hell."
We did much better the second time," Trump noted.
The people are very angry.
